text: on Thursday the UK will vote on whether
to remain in the European Union or leave
the European Union unless it's really
close the result should be known by
early on Friday
whatever happens nothing will change
immediately there is likely to be a
statement from David Cameron straight
away if it's remain that could be a
stock market bounce when trading starts
if it's leave many experts expects a
sharp fall in shares and in the value of
the pound there's already been
volatility as the markets react to
opinion polls Europe's top leaders are
likely to breathe a sigh of relief in
the event of a win four remain if it's
leave expects anger and dismay and
possibly emergency meetings in Brussels
back in the UK David Cameron's future as
Prime Minister will be under scrutiny a
comfortable remain vote should be enough
for him to see off a leadership
challenge a leave vote could make his
position untenable although he insists
he'll stay if there's a leave vote when
will the official exit button be pushed
the process is set out by article 50 of
the Lisbon Treaty David Cameron has said
he will start the leaving process
without undue delay there's a two-year
period for the terms of exit to be
negotiated the UK and the EU would have
to work out a new deal on trade if the
UK doesn't want to exit the single
market it could still have to pay
towards the EU budget and still follow
the EU rules and regulations allowing
the free movement of people from
elsewhere in Europe might be required as
well it's unclear what would happen to
British citizens already living in other
EU countries and EU citizens living in
Britain many laws and regulations made
in the EU over the decades would need to
be updated into UK law if there's a
remain vote Britain's relationship with
Europe may change anyway as countries
that use the euro push towards closer
integration David Cameron's secured a
special
status for the UK completely in the
single market but out of the euro and
exempted from ever closer Union so we
should know if the UK wishes to remain
in or leave the EU by the end of this
week but if the vote is closed some
people think there could be more
referendums to come
